website_summaries.verdict: A brushless motor gives a turbo boost to this cordless leaf blower.
pros: WORX uses turbine fan technology to give this unit a high-capacity air volume
Hyper-stream air nozzle stands up to heavy use and tough conditions
Ergonomic design for the best weight distribution reduces fatigue
Variable speed control with turbo boost
Power tool hangs from key-shaped cutout
cons: Using at full power reduces battery run time

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery
customer_reviews.text: Same battery problem that others have reported - after 6 months, the battery will not charge. Interesting, Amazon sent me an unsolicited email "recommendation" today for a replacement battery - at a cost of $127. Forget it! I already wasted $190 by purchasing this in the first place. Seems like rechargeable battery technology is a real problem area for a lot of companies. Maybe I should be happy that this thing didn't catch on fire like a cell phone or a hoverboard.
customer_reviews.author: John Vojta

customer_reviews.title: I love the design of the blower
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the fist one because it didn't work. I have had the new one for three months, have used maybe once a week and the battery life just keeps getting lower. It is now down to about 20 minutes of use, which is just not enough time for any kind of thorough leaf blowing. I love the design of the blower, it is light and easy to use, but the battery is worthless. I have waited to long to return it so I'm stuck with it now and will have to purchase another battery!! So if you have more than 15-20 minutes of work to do I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KNT

customer_reviews.title: Issue with battery life and cost for a second battery
customer_reviews.text: Love this blower, but it falls way short in that the battery only lasts about 10min on high! I bought it to blow dry my new corvette after I foam washed the car. Problem it will not blow dry the car in 10 min. So I contacted Amazon, who was great handling the problem by getting on the phone with me with the company to verify why it only lasted the 10 min. I thought I would order anther battery but the cost was $156.00 for another extra battery. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken B

customer_reviews.title: Battery went bad twice in one year!
customer_reviews.text: Red light blinking on charger - would not charge. Worx provided replacements both times but took 4 weeks to get the new battery. meanwhile I had no blower! When the next battery goes bad, the blower is going in the trash, certainly not paying $130 for a replacement battery!
customer_reviews.author: joyuslion

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL cordless blower - excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever leaf blower, I bought this Worx 56v unit after reading several reviews on cordless leaf blowers. I am glad I chose this one. It is very powerful, it does normal average leaf and debris just fine and also does a great job getting under cars and in hard to reach spots. It will also move heavy bulky items like rocks or wood if necessary. I am very pleased with this Worx blower, I have since bought other Worx tools because this one is so good.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Powerful blower
customer_reviews.text: I researched all battery blowers and this one was at the top of many lists. I’m not about to spend $300 on a blower so price point was also important. It’s construction and operation is very impressive. Extremely powerful airflow. Full disclosure: I returned it because the battery life just isn’t sufficient for my needs and second battery is $103. At full power you can get about 15 minutes of operation and I routinely have to blow leaves for 1-2 hours. If your needs are lighter and/or you don’t mind investing another $100 this is a very impressive machine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Nettles

customer_reviews.title: Very limited
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for over a month and am disappointed for 2 reasons: 1) the cost of $160 which I was willing to pay if I got what I hoped I'd be getting 2) limited range, all I do is charge the battery and the cost for a 2nd battery is ridiculous This unit is only good for cleaning off driveway and walkways and it does that really well. I thought I would rid myself of the hassle of gas powered blower, now I will have that and a $160 broom as well.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good as gas backpack ones but....
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an otr trucker for cleaning out trailers with left over debris from pallets and such and it works perfectly. Actually just as good as a backpack blower which is what I used at my previous job as a landscaper. Of course it being battery operated it doesn't last as long as I'd like it to. I can get through 2 or 3 trailers before it runs out of juice plus several days in between before I get to my next trailers. What's awesome is it takes only 30 minutes to fully recharge so if I have to wait I will just wait out the time do paperwork and such and it's ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Easy going
customer_reviews.text: I live under a canopy of oak and walnut. This blower is lightweight and powerful. It's handy for clearing leaves and twigs from the decks, concrete and roof. Gas engines are high maintenance with fuel mixture, carburetor, plugs and filter issues. Electrical cords limit movement and require frequent adjustment. Of course, the battery will discharge after 20 minutes of use, even faster on high speed, which is overkill anyway. That is easily managed with a 2nd battery in rotation, same as one would do with a drill or saw. I am pleased with this product and hope Worx adds a 56 V chainsaw to the line.
customer_reviews.author: Luther

customer_reviews.title: The battery capacity is extremely poor on the unit I bought
customer_reviews.text: The battery capacity is extremely poor on the unit I bought. It doesn't last 10 minutes on near-high speed. I am very disappointed and am contemplating returning the unit, though I will give it one more try. I have had a lot of battery powered tools and this is by far the worse with regard to battery life. When first on with a freshly-charged battery, it does pack a punch with the volume of air movement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great power & convenience!
customer_reviews.text: It's the best thing I ever had, no more fighting with a gas blower. Battery only lasts like 15 minutes on high power should consider buying a second battery. Takes approximately 90 minutes to fully charge the battery
customer_reviews.author: Carmen G. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good, Strong Blower
customer_reviews.text: Read the other reviews after I purchased this. Was worried therefore about the battery and the run time. In practice the battery is great. I ran it on low power setting and after 40 to 45 minutes it was still going strong. The lowest setting is plenty adequate for blowing leaves, sticks, etc. At that setting it even starts to blow pebbles, dirt, and gravel, which I didn't want. I imagine at the highest setting it's run time would be shorter. I didn't test this. But for the amount of blowing power I need it is fine. Wonderful not to bother with gasoline or cords.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Cato

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Blower
customer_reviews.text: Don't often write reviews but this deserves one. Bought it 10 months ago and it and its still performing like new. I have a smallish southern Arizona yard with crushed gravel landscaping. I use it about twice a week to clean up yard and entry ways of leaves and debris. It does an excellent job. On full power it blows the gravel around. On full power the battery will run down in 10 to 20 minutes so may not be suitable for large yards without extra batteries. Half power meets most of my needs. Have had no battery or charging problem. Meets my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence V. Mann

customer_reviews.title: I recommend looking into gas powered devices
customer_reviews.text: On a fully charged battery, it only lasted 5-10 minutes before totally draining the battery. This might be okay for quick, light-duty work, but not for trying to clear leaves from a yard. It is possible I received a defective battery, but I returned it without trying another battery. If you have a decent sized yard to clear, I recommend looking into gas powered devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McKeown

customer_reviews.title: Longer battery time greatly overestimated. Great power though.
customer_reviews.text: My old smaller Worx blower didn’t have great battery life but has worked great for several years. It takes about 2-3 20V batteries to do my yard. After reading reviews on this one I decided to upgrade to get more battery life and more power. It’s definitely more powerful; yay! But the 49V battery life is poor. We have a tiny yard and the blower battery power died after less than 1/2 the yard. Not good and since the 40V batteries are so much more expensive and heavier, this isn’t a good value.
customer_reviews.author: AudiOx

customer_reviews.title: Wow! A truly impressive leaf blower!
customer_reviews.text: For years now, I have used my trusty Black & Decker corded leaf blower. It works well enough, but dragging around the cord & untangling it from my shrubs is a pain. So, I tried this WORX blower. It is amazing. It's not only much quieter than my old B&D blower, but it seems to be more powerful, and it's so light & maneuverable that I can do my entire planting beds & deck in less than half the time now. Expensive but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Clean Look and Fairly light
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower is pretty good. Fairly afford for the machine itself, however, the battery costs a fortune. Luckily, I was able to find one for pretty cheap. I really like the design and look of this model. The machine comes in 3 pieces that you assemble together. One of the pieces (tip) is nearly impossible to separate once you assembled it which has been a huge draw back for me. I wish it was easily be taken apart for storage. Nevertheless, the unit and performance is up to par with a 56V unit you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Neel

customer_reviews.title: Need it to use it for more than 10 minutes find another product.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is horrible even on medium speed setting. If you can blow off your entire yard in 10 minutes at medium speed then it might work for you. At full speed it will stand up to a gas blower for at least 5 minutes then you'll need to recharge it. Regretting my purchase as the battery life is just so bad it's not usable in my situation. I'm convinced that all of the reviews I've read which did not mention the battery life have a vested interest in giving a good review.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good blower. It is powerful, comparable to any plug in, but.... The battery life is shorter than short. It is a great tool for small areas. Big yards, not so much. Problem is the cost of an additional battery is nearly the cost of the original purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zaneman007

customer_reviews.title: The battery mAH is a joke for this blower
customer_reviews.text: The battery is weak! They should not have shipped this with a 2maH battery. It does not power the blower very long. I did my deck, driveway and a little bit of my yard and it died. Power level 1 and 2 are useless. Maybe if you used it to blow sawdust off a workbench but not for leaves. They should not have shipped this with a low capacity battery. And they want 100bucks for a replacement. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Zedhound

customer_reviews.title: This is a powerful, light weight, relatively quiet blower with a variable speed thumb switch
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful, light weight, relatively quiet blower with a variable speed thumb switch. I bought this to use when I have a perfectly good electric cord blower and I do not regret it. I love this thing. I did not like dragging around a cord all over the yard and often didn't use a blower when I needed to. I know there might be a problem with the battery lasting, but I have two other Worx tools and so I have three batteries. I will just replace them when I need to replace them--a good tool that has the power to do the job is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: pcsnake

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Product
customer_reviews.text: This is hurricane. Really good product for a cheap price. Getting rid of my backyard of cut grass and dried leaves is now more easier and faster. Just need extra battery for cleaning wider area because battery runs out fast when higher air speed is used. Overall, product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rolito Sabulao

customer_reviews.title: Works great - ten minutes at a time
customer_reviews.text: This is a great choice if you have a small property, or just want to use it for a driveways/sidewalks/etc. It's powerful enough to remove fairly sizeable piles of leaves. In terms of power, it exceeded the abilities of my Echo backpack blower, which was more expensive. I have no complaints about the I can do my driveway (takes about ten minutes - it's a long driveway) before the battery is drained. It seems to drain completely in ten minutes and they advertise a 90-minute full charge time. It may be worth it to purchase another battery for extended use and switch batteries when the charge is depleted. As with life, YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Very strong cordless blower
customer_reviews.text: Very strong blower. Better than my gas or corded blowers which I no longer need. The battery is interchangeable with my WORX trimmer, so I have a backup battery if needed. If I don't use full power (which still does the job) the battery lasts longer. I can still do my 125' driveway, front porch, back porch, walkways and deck on one charge at full power. I am sold on WORX products!
customer_reviews.author: WWingate

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery
customer_reviews.text: Like others said, the power of this blower is fantastic. However, that was ruined by the fact that after only a few months it stopped holding a charge. Installing the battery immediately after charging it gives me barely five minutes of power. Since others have had the same problem, I'm assuming this is a major product defect. Waiting to hear back from customer service but not expecting much help given what I've read.
customer_reviews.author: JzyGirl60

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE PURCHASING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe what just happened to me! I woke to find my house filled with foul smelling burning odor and found the battery bellowing with smoke. I managed to throw the battery and charger outside where it continued to pop, crack and emit metallic smelling smoke . I finally had to use a hose to put the internal fire out! I wonder what would have happened if I had not been here? I find my very expensive blower now useless ,and I am NOT going to buy another battery. So beware!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JWood

customer_reviews.title: battery doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed in it because the battery life just doesn't last very long maybe like 20 minutes so I bought another battery and at a hundred bucks that one last a little bit longer but they take so long to charge up I wish I could send it back and get a gas one. ****UPDATE**** I have used this for about a month now. I like it, the blower does work really well lots of air power. The product does work just as described.
customer_reviews.author: yodave

customer_reviews.title: Battery goes bad - quidk
customer_reviews.text: The battery stopped working. We got 2 falls out of this leaf blower and now the battery is shot. Won’t charge, won’t run, nothing. The batteries are just as expensive as the unit itself (battery included). I wouldn’t waste your time with this. Shop another brand. The batteries are NOT GOOD and the blower is useless without the expensive battery
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: No Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I spent almost $200 on this leaf blower and it stated that the battery charge would last up to 90 mins. I barely get 10 mins out of a full charge. This was either sold with a defective battery or the manufacturer completely lied about the battery life. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight for the power
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be heavier than it is after having a corded electric blower for many years (which is heavier). It's also well balanced. As other's have noted, there is a couple second delay from when you turn it on to when it engages but once you know that it's not an issue. The variable speed is GREAT. Even at the lowest speed it's still pretty powerful and perfect for blowing out a garage without creating a huge dust cloud inside. It's not going to move a mountain of leaves but it will move quite a bit. It's perfect for many quick jobs.
customer_reviews.author: TMH

customer_reviews.title: Portability
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good portable blower. I like the part of no brushes and I can take it about anywhere when using it. It has a very powerful air output. It would have been great if it had come with two batteries, you can buy addition batteries but they are very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L EWW

customer_reviews.title: I'll never sweep again!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a blower so I don't have anything to compare this unit to, but this thing is awesome. I can clean off a porch, deck, stairs in a matter of 30 seconds each. Wow! This unit was originally purchased to clean sawdust off my husband's sawmill. He loves it too! If the battery can be recharged for a few years, this unit is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Great blower with very short operating time (10 minutes)
customer_reviews.text: This blower works well, has plenty of power and is comfortable to use. It is only practical for short jobs. Forget it for cleaning the leaves off your lawn. Brand new, after a full charge, the unit stopped dead after 10 minutes of use. Even if you had multiple batteries, it wouldn't be practical to change them every 10 minutes. Until battery technology improves, these battery operated blowers are only good for small, short time jobs.
customer_reviews.author: John Chan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blower with a hungry motor.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, lightweight blower. However, it runs for about 20 minutes with a full charge when blowing leaves. Consider buying a spair battery or you may be waiting for it to charge to complete your chore.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Brimo

customer_reviews.title: This blower is SUPER powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This blower is SUPER powerful.....and I can clear off my sizable driveway of leaves and copious pine needles in a jiffy. Be aware, it is intended for BIG jobs, not small, and does not have a tiny focused opening, but a large one that can just above move furniture. For small jobs I bought the WORX WG575.1 WORXAIR Lithium Multi-Purpose Blower/Sweeper/Cleaner, 32-volt which works perfect around the flowerpots, etc, and for "sweeping out" the garage. These are both lightweight, efficient, wonderfully cordless and a Must for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kaaren Babb

customer_reviews.title: Great for jobs < 15 mins in duration
customer_reviews.text: Power - we use this to sweep leaves off a smooth concrete pool deck. It works fine. If you tried to use this to blow leaves out of grass I don't think it will have the power to do this well. Even if you cranked it all the way up the battery drain at the highest setting drains the battery in about 15 mins. It's the best of the battery-powered blowers but battery power simply isn't as powerful as gas-powered. For spots where a corded blower isn't practical or you dont want to fire up the gas-powered --- this works great.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower to replace a finicky gas blower. It is very powerful and the battery lasts a reasonable amount of time to get through Saturday lawn and leaf chores. The Worx hangs in the garage and because it is so easy to use, my wife does not hesitate to pick it up and clear off the entry and sidewalk. Not so with the old pull start gas blower. This is a clean and powerful alternative to gas.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: OMG, does thing work GREAT :) , so Happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this , I am 5'1" a 112 lbs and this is light weight, but boy does it do the job.. You hit turbo on it and the job is done. I have used it to clear my gutters, side walks, driveway, my siding to get rid of spider webs and every thing else. I may buy a back up in case some thing should happen to this one.. This is 2 thumbs up all the way... Love this so much better than my pack on..
customer_reviews.author: Karkinen Daycare

customer_reviews.title: Great Blower
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I am totally impressed with this blower. We are replacing a gas powered blower with it. The WORX blower is lighter, quitter, and a dream to start when compared to our gas blower. All of this being said, the WORX blower has as much if not more power than the gas blower. It does an excellent job. I would recommend this to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Best Battery-Powered Leaf Blower on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the right combination of power, weight, cost, and battery life. The WORX WG591 easily meets all categories. I rarely have to use full power with this machine, and when I do it feels exactly like a gas-powered blower working full blast, but far quieter and of course no stinky exhaust! Great battery life as I have yet to work the machine to exhaustion.
customer_reviews.author: obxkarma

customer_reviews.title: Has power to get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Really like that it is cordless and no gasoline. So far have only used to blow debris off front porch, sidewalk and patio. Very happy with the two-speeds power and satisfaction with the great results. Another plus is the hanging device for the battery charger and the blower. More than met expectations, although have used long enough to see lasting power of battery.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Green

customer_reviews.title: Great product.....UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: great tool well balanced. Powerful. The ease of cordless....Whole new world. Get another battery if you have big property. Great around my patios and pool areas. UPDATE 3YEARS: finally i have a problem. Blower motor not running. My battery is at full charge assuming unit is bad. After running this blower on a daily basis around house and yard. Cant live without this one. Ordered just blower no batt or charger $89.00 not bad. You spend more than that on a battery.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY, BAD BATTERY, BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: Excellent powe; but only lasts for 3-4 minutes then it dies. I have used it 5 times since I purchased it. I have only had this since June. I reached out to the company 2 weeks ago and have gotten no response. Terrible customer service and very disappointed that Amazon is offering this product and not upholding them to a higher level of customer service. I want a full refund and I am happy to give back the machine. DON’T BUY THIS YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenixville

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit!
customer_reviews.text: This unit really moves stuff! I easily cleaned out my stuffed gutters without ever switching to Turbo. I use this guy to blow off my 600 ft2 patio in about 1 minute on medium. Also, my garage gets cleaned out in about 30 seconds. I have heard complaints about battery time, but I've only run into this once, where I was blowing sticks into piles in my yard. I had it on Turbo for about 15 minutes and poof! No more juice. Re-charge time was about 90 minutes, which isn't too bad. I love this unit, and my neighbors are jealous because I won't let them use it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Paul Hinchliff

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Blower
customer_reviews.text: This blower is so convenient since it has a rechargeable battery...thus no cord and no gasoline required. The adjustable blowing power is wonderful and it is very strong when on the highest setting. The only downside is that the battery needs to be charged fairly frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: A lot of power, but requires a lot of energy
customer_reviews.text: Which translates into needing to have at least 2 batteries and possibly 3! The batteries are not cheap. If you have a BIG yard or area needing some air movement multiple, batteries are required. We have a relatively small garage and driveway and at full air power, 1 battery cannot sustain full power.
customer_reviews.author: dfwsig

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life!
customer_reviews.text: The battery only stays charged 8 - 15 minutes - unless you have it on low - which doesn't blow anything! I am returning this and buying an eco blower. Same price - long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Cforten5

customer_reviews.title: LEMON
customer_reviews.text: this blower is terrible and shouldn't even be legally sold because the battery barely works and the blower dies ever 10-15 minutes. impossible to get anything done when it dies all the time and then takes hours to charge. completely unreliable. fix the battery and then put it back on the market when the product actually works properly. stop selling lemons.
customer_reviews.author: John Odell

customer_reviews.title: Good power.  You will want a second battery
customer_reviews.text: Good power. Battery lasted time it took to blow off a long 150 foot driveway. Then stopped. Second battery needed if you want to try something like fall leave clean up of a yard of much size. Great the batteries are interchangeable with other devices like the trimmer (works great), and even the lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: Sting J

customer_reviews.title: Good tool but buy a second battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. However, battery life is an issue at the higher settings. If you intend to use it on a larger area you will need a second battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Powerfull
customer_reviews.text: Very light and powerful! When you turn it on, it kicks back a little due to it's power! The battery lasts a good while. It is great for the patio around the pool!
customer_reviews.author: flutie

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: produces a forceful stream. The battery charger does not get hot. Much more convenient than the plug in type
customer_reviews.author: ksredhook

customer_reviews.title: Much more than expected.,...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting mediocre blowing power and Average battery life..., I was pleasantly surprised to have underestimated this unit on both accounts. It’s a very strong blower (I really like the variable speeds), & the battery last a good 20 minutes on full power (roughly 30 minutes toggling between lower power levels). Perfect for the size of my yard. I have two Worx trimmers, & I should have know that Worx products deliver EXACTLY what they claim! This blower was a REALLY good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish the battery didn't fail.
customer_reviews.text: Great volume of air movement. Lightweight. Battery failed just before the deadline to return . . . so it was returned in the nick of time. Close call.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worked as good as my corded blowers
customer_reviews.text: Worked as good as my corded blowers. Plenty of power and airflow. Did a good job of moving leaves and debris without kicking up too many of my landscape rocks. I charged the battery before use and it lasted 15 minutes, which was enough to do my blower chores for my quarter acre residential tract home lot. I would estimate I used it at half power for 80% of the time and full power about 20% of the time. So much less trouble than getting out an extension cord just to do 15 minutes worth of work.
customer_reviews.author: The Cat Family

customer_reviews.title: Another Amazon product that is not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The blower is VERY powerful as described, and creates hurricane force winds. As with other reviews, neither the charger nor the battery gives any indication of charge status via its LCD lights. They are completely nonfunctional. Despite that, the battery seems to charge and hold a charge as appropriate. For the price, I would have expected it to function as advertised. Hopefully, it will continue to work ok in the future. Nice blower, but all the bells and whistles don't work. Is this a function of what Amazon sells, or the WORX product??? I suspect the former.
customer_reviews.author: Duped customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy
customer_reviews.text: This a very light blower so my wife can handle it with ease. She also has no worry about having to pull a recoil cord to start it as she has reoccurring shoulder issues - just push the button and you're off and running. It has enough battery to do my large driveway, deck, brick patio and sidewalk with one charge. If you are blowing a lot of leaves in the fall you would need to have more than one battery on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Blueport

customer_reviews.title: Bought because it is battery operated and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower works perfectly for me. It has lots of power and is lightweight. I don't have a large yard, so the battery holds its charge while I'm working. However, at a previous residence, when I did use for a long period of time, the battery did need recharged, so maybe not for very large jobs. I like that I can just grab it and go... no cords, no gasoline. I've had it now for over a year and am really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal gma

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact of quickly having a blower ready to quickly remove trash from my large porches and garage. The battery is sufficient for that. However, the battery does not last long enough when the tennis court is the “project”. (I have not timed the use, but probably does not last 20-30 minutes when fully charged. )
customer_reviews.author: Carole C. Terral

customer_reviews.title: Good wind - heavy tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious blower, but not for a long enough time. The 56 volt battery is done in 15 minutes if you use the turbo power, which may be the case during the season of leaf dropping. The tool is a bit heavy with the battery and large back end and it will suck to your pant leg if the tool gets close. I'll continue to evaluate this. It does well clearing grass cuttings and other debris.
customer_reviews.author: Harry C.

customer_reviews.title: Killer Power
customer_reviews.text: I have had several battery operated blowers and this item is phenomenal in comparison. I also have a WORX lawn mower that shares the same batteries with. I have had the mower for 3 years and it performs excellent also.
customer_reviews.author: Ronobono

customer_reviews.title: If you got a yard larger than a postage stamp don’t bother to buy
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive for what you get battery power last maybe 5 to 10 minutes very disappointed with this product sent back to shipper called WORX told turbo power last 4 minutes on high 7 minutes then it goes dead DO NOT BUY TERRIBLE PRODUCT after refunding blower they tried to with hold 70 dollars in restocking fee then complained an they still held 20 dollars BEWARE NOT A GIOD COMPANY TO DEAL WITH
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Fuccello

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for back pack gas nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Huskv***rna back pack blower from the big box store. After one rebuilt carb and multiple gas line repairs thanks to ethanol I'd had enough. My expectaions have been exceeded. This unit has more power, is quieter, and the battery lasts me 3-4 uses before recharging. Using the "turbo" mode will move large sticks and mulch around. I can get the job done on half power very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Gnater

customer_reviews.title: Good and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a birthday gift for husband. It’s good at blowing leaves off the deck. Power blowing is adjustable. Seems to hold battery life to about 45 minutes depending on force of blower. Recharge time is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's a compromise, but will work for many
customer_reviews.text: Wish the battery would go a little longer, but always knew there'd be some level of compromise in going electric in this type of device. If backup batteries weren't so expensive, it would be less of an issue to keep backup on charge. Expect about 20-30 minutes of full blow per charge on a new unit. I use for blowing down a clean car before towel finishing. Will blow out standard garage debris no worries also. Definitely not lacking in power, just stamina.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M Wray

customer_reviews.title: Will buy from Worx again
customer_reviews.text: I have about a quarter of an acre lot that my house is on and I have a metal roof with gutters and the battery puts out enough force for the South in the fall and spring. Also I find that I barely need to use the turbo setting, mainly when cleaning out my gutters twice a year. On one charge it does my entire yard...
customer_reviews.author: HeyHeyHey

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this so much he owns 2 now!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband a different model from HD and he prefers this one so I bought him an extra one for the back patio, and he uses the other one in the garage and driveway. He's happy, so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: No excuses now
customer_reviews.text: No reason not to go out and quickly blow off the leaves from the driveway. Power is great even without having to use "turbo"; battery has been lasting as long as advertised and enough for me to do driveway and front yard before recharging and doing the back one later. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Psorcon

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice Product. Very powerful and moves grass, dirt, leaves with ease. Only issue; battery life is very poor. Doesn't last while I blow my small yard. A second battery is outrageously expensive. But it beats pulling out that extension cord or dealing with fuel & oil.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Serves every purpose it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blower mainly for cleaning off our riding mowers and driveways. It has the definite power I needed and is light weight enough for me to handle.
customer_reviews.author: MAMA TILL

customer_reviews.title: go cordless
customer_reviews.text: This is not a gasoline powered blower. It is not as noisy, stinky, dangerous, or environmentally irresponsible as gasoline. On the maximum speed setting, it is nearly as powerful as a gas blower. But it works quite well at lower speeds. It's light enough that my wife is happy to use it. And the power packs are interchangeable with my other Worx 56V appliances.
customer_reviews.author: johnmarkcarter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely impressed with this blower this product. I am moving forward in purchasing everything from the lawnmower to the pole chainsaw the edger the hedger everything love love highly recommend this product you will put out a little bit of money but I think in the long run it will make your life so much less stressful no gasoline no mess no oil no struggling to start it up what else could be better
customer_reviews.author: Rjhanson69

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this blower
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this blower. Wow I think it has a ton of power. So happy I bought this. Highly recommend. I never had a gas powered one and no plans to ever have one. But I can’t see how it could be better then this. This does the job. I have two batteries. I can trim my whole yard and blow it and I have half an acre. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: This product really blows
customer_reviews.text: This cordless blower has worked out great for me. I am just using it around my house and the battery last long enough to do the front yard porch, sidewalks and driveway and the back yard patio and sidewalks. Don't think it will work for blowing large amounts of leaves off of a lawn because of the battery life. Also because of the battery life it wouldn't be feasible for commercial use but all depends on how you are using it. My personal favorite use is blowing out my garage which only takes about a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of All

customer_reviews.title: Too loud at full speed
customer_reviews.text: This product is a bit cumbersome due to size and very loud when used at full speed. It is also heavier than I like. It does work well however. It does well at a lower setting and is not as loud at that setting.
customer_reviews.author: wpguro

customer_reviews.title: Blower does a great job
customer_reviews.text: For years I used gas motor blowers, but I am happy to have this battery powered blower. It is strong for moving leaves, etc. After using it a few times I learned how to conserve the battery by lowering the speed, and the battery has a good life. I highly recommend this blower.
customer_reviews.author: NCJack

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS BLOWER - does not perform well for long duration.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED - AMAZON SAVED THE DAY and will do the right thing, Incredible incredible service by Amazon, amazing COMPANY -- This item is unsatisfactory, past 30 day Amazon return, and performs for 8 minutes at full speed before battery dies. Then 1.5 hours to recharge. Called WORX, they don't care to help. I am going to return this to someone I want my money back. I'd vote less than 1 star but 1 star is the lowest. Too bad... I had faith, but the advertisements are very misleading and mesmerizing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike DellaMedaglia

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast.
customer_reviews.text: Blows like a beast. Battery goes fast on turbo mode but turbo mode will move bricks and throw gravel. Even on the low setting blew my yard clippings. Midway and it blew some old leaves and crap behind the garage like a gas powered unit. Its battery convenience maybe buy a spare or Stihll BR 650 if you have a large yard.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great power. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worx for me. Easy to handle and lightweight. I wish it had a longer runtime but I knew going into it that at High it’s maybe 15min. I have a huge yard-acres. And I can use the battery from my edger/trimmer- also a worx. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A.

customer_reviews.title: Best battery powered blower ever
customer_reviews.text: Best battery powered blower ever, so light weight and easy to control. Blows all the leaves off my driveway when on high power, and good for more delicate jobs around plants on deck. If you have it on constantly high power, however, will only last about 30 minutes but that's enough time for my job in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: CathyS

customer_reviews.title: BLOWER
customer_reviews.text: BEST BLOWER MADE. BEATS ELECTRIC 210 MPH.BLOWERS BY 3 TIMES BOUGHT ALL 3 OF MY ADULT KIDS ONE FOR CHRISTMAS AND THEY LOVE THEIRS ALSO.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item
customer_reviews.text: The WORX WG591 Turbine 56V Cordless Battery-Powered Leaf Blower with Brushless Motor & TurboBoost is a quality product. It has the ability to provide as much leaf blowing power as needed. Another great WORX product.
customer_reviews.author: COLDT

customer_reviews.title: Battery power POOR
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June 2018. The air power is excellent, EXCEPT the battery only lasts about 10-15 minutes, not enough time to clean up around the house. I contacted Workx directly, and they confirmed that 10-15 minutes is normal for this leaf blower. They also recommended I purchase a spare battery, not the solution I wanted to hear. Would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Just got it recently so can’t speak for its durability as of yet. But initial impression is good, does what it’s intended to do well, it’s not too heavy or bulky. Battery doesn’t last very long, but from reviews I saw before buying neither do most
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Best Cordless Leaf Blower
customer_reviews.text: Extremely strong wind velocity. Variable speed button is a good feature since the full power mode is not always necessary. Always using it in the full power mode leads to a shorter battery run time. Regardless, this is a real winner!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, lightweight blower
customer_reviews.text: This blower is perfect for me. I really like the variable speed. It’s lightweight. The battery stays charged long enough for me to blow off my entire deck. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Laird

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for medium to small yards
customer_reviews.text: Nice not to carry a cord but battery only last about 10 minutes. It does blow most leaves from the grass but not all. If wind going against you the blowing will be more difficult. The product arrived quickly but box was damaged. Charging battery takes 1 and half hours. If you can afford an additional battery that might be usuful to work longer than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: tvantenna

customer_reviews.title: Blower
customer_reviews.text: Yard work, but the product was defective, battery wouldn’t take a charge. Had to return the blower and on top of that , had to pay $47.00 dollars in postage. Amazon would not accept it back . Had to send back to the company . Plus they had no replacement battery’s. Product was discontinued . Not what I expected from amazon! Really didn’t get to us the blower. Why did I have to pay for return postage?
customer_reviews.author: Linda R

customer_reviews.title: Great battery operated  blower
customer_reviews.text: This is a great battery operated blower and the weight is perfect for a 70 year old woman to operate. Using it to clean a large porch and small courtyard.
customer_reviews.author: golfer gal

customer_reviews.title: Very short time at high power
customer_reviews.text: This is a very limited lawn blower when at max power you on get 11 minutes of service before re-charge. I expected at least 30-45 minutes at max power. Read a lot of recommendations before purchasing and saw “very” few negative comments, especially those regarding short times at full power.
customer_reviews.author: SCOT A WOODARD

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. A lightweight but powerful leaf blower that holds a charge. It exceeded expectations especially battery life per charge. I have a small but leafy yard and I highly recommend it .
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Schoen

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This blower has worked well for blowing leaves (primariiy). When I bought it, I thought that it was going to come with 2 batteries....which would have been ideal, since it only runs for 20-25 minutes on the provided battery. It does not however...so if you think you'll want to do a job that takes more time than that....maybe go for a gas powered one.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Smith

customer_reviews.title: good.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power in this thing! It does use up the battery rather quickly if I use it full blast but full blast is rarely required. It's light weight and handy. If it had a longer lasting battery I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Tabby

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent machine.
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment on durability because I have only used it twice, but it performed well, moving even wet leaves with ease. The speed is controlled from slow to fast with a simple thumb rotation, making it as accurate as sweeping with a broom. I am a professional product designer and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: Light weight.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blower I ever had, I do have several batteries for them too! But it moves leaves quickly into a pile, it is light weight for a women and easy to maneuver. I have an extra larger front and rear yard with large trees. It makes my job a lot easier to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: gloria jenders

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful and Lightweight enough for my 80 year old mother to handle
customer_reviews.text: Is very powerful and lightweight----on full power it sounds like an airplane (slight exaggeration). I bought for my 80 year old mother for her birthday. It is easy for her to handle and she uses it to blow leaves, gravel, etc. off her carport---no more sweeping with a broom----it is also powerful enough to move pea gravel from her sidewalks and landscape area---leaves nice edging. Interested to see how it does with snow this winter. Overall, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Working Lady

customer_reviews.title: Worx!
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for me for at least 3 months now. Fully charged battery only lasts 15 minutes, but can clear an entire tennis court of leaves in that time. Recommended, but buy an extra battery with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Johansen

customer_reviews.title: Battery Drain on highest speed
customer_reviews.text: The problem is the battery. Do not run on the highest air speed or you will drain the battery in 10 minutes. Use only the force neccrsary.
customer_reviews.author: J. MacDonlad

customer_reviews.title: It’s good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Use it for grass clippings. A little louder than some others but it has a descent amount of power and lasts a good amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for cordless
customer_reviews.text: For a cordless leaf blower this is pretty impressive. Even the wet leaves on the ground the lower can handle on the strongest setting. We would recommend getting a second battery, however, as if you use the strongest setting for all or most of the time it doesn't last too long. It takes 2-3 charges of the battery for us to do our whole yard, which is just under an acre.
customer_reviews.author: Mirandees

product_meta.title: WORX WG591 Turbine 56V Cordless Battery-Powered Leaf Blower with Brushless Motor & TurboBoost
product_meta.description: Style:56V Battery + Charger IncludedThe WORX WG591 Turbine 56-Volt Cordless Blower with Brushless Motor features variable speed capabilities. This allows you to gently clean out corners of the garage or patio and then crank up the power to pile up those leaves in the yard. The WG591 is a powerful 56V Max Lithium, lightweight cordless blower with TURBINE technology and a brushless motor which delivers up to 465cfm of air velocity. This allows you to get the job done quickly and efficiently. The blower has an ergonomic handle to make the job comfortable and the tool easy to handle. This blower is part of the WORX 56-Volt Power share program and the battery is interchangeable with all of the other 56-Volt tools in the lineup.
feature_bullets: Turbine fan technology delivers forceful, high capacity air volume, hyper stream air nozzle handles extra tough conditions
Weighing only 8.1 pounds, the ergonomic design ensures optimal weight distribution to save on fatigue for those larger tasks
Variable speed control with turbo boost is located in the Perfect position for one handed operation
Key hole shaped cutout on tool lets you hang it on your existing hooks, bolts, or nails; Charging time = 90 min
Powerful 56V Max Lithium battery provides cordless convenience to quickly clean up your outdoor spaces such as decks or patios

The back of the motor housing is the air intake for the Turbine leaf blower; Keep all loose clothing, hair and debris away from this area to avoid accident, injury or damage to the tool; Hold the blower at your side and keep the back of the motor housing clear at all times

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars851 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
